intro: Theodorea gebleriana, commonly known as the Gebler's lily, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
